subject: Re: [junit] Anyone have experience with Confluence and jUnit?
msgSnippet: Hi, Jeff. ... When you say adopting Confluence, do you mean adopting it as a platform on which you build your own application? I haven t developed anything on
messageBody:
Hi, Jeff.

On Mon, Feb 23, 2009 at 10:16 PM, Jeff <jjg@...> wrote:
> Our group is thinking of adopting Confluence and as one of the ardent
> jUnit testers I've been asked to investigate it.
>
> Does anyone have any experiences (good/bad) with it? Are there any large
> projects that use it? Good places to get started on it?

When you say adopting Confluence, do you mean adopting it as a
platform on which you build your own application?

I haven't developed anything on top of Confluence myself but I have
seen a multi-module Maven project with one of the modules being a
skeleton for a Confluence plugin (generated with Atlassian's tools, I
believe). That skeleton had a bunch of automated tests itself so even
if they took ages to run (can't remember exactly but it was several
minutes) at least the existence of automated tests suggests that it's
not the worst platform to build on.

Of course, this is just an educated guess so... Grain of salt.

Lasse

--
Lasse Koskela
* Author of "Test Driven" (Manning Publications, 2007) *
* Reaktor Innovations * http://www.ri.fi/en *
